title: Bulgaria 0-6 England - Euro 2020 qualifier: RESULT
text:
It was Raheem Sterling who had summed it up best — at a press conference in Prague last Thursday.

Asked if he feared this would be a trip marred by racism from the stands, Sterling explained that some countries still had discrimination engrained in their cultures. It didn’t sound like a warning at the time but here on a dismal, sorry night in Sofia, we began to understand exactly what Sterling meant.

READ: The full match report from the Euro 2020 qualifier in Sofia

England will be looking to bounce back from their first qualifying defeat for over a decade as they look to book a spot at Euro 2020 next summer when they visit Bulgaria.

An insipid performance saw Gareth Southgate's side slip to a 2-1 loss in the Czech Republic on Friday but they can book their spot at the European Championship if they win and Kosovo fail to defeat Montenegro.

Join DAN RIPLEY for all the action from the Vasil Levski Stadium as it happens with kick-off from 7.45pm BST.
description: Raheem Sterling and Ross Barkley both scored twice for England as they bounced back from defeat in the Czech Republic but the game was overshadowed by racism from home fans.
